{"step_by_step_thinking": "The saliva buffer system is responsible for maintaining the pH of the mouth. The main components of this system are bicarbonates, phosphates, and proteins. Amino acids are not a significant part of the saliva buffer system. Carbonic acids and phosphates are important in both stimulated and unstimulated saliva. Therefore, the saliva buffer system having low importance in stimulated saliva would be amino acids.", "answer_choice": "A"}
